subject: Bug Report: Recurring Events Not Filtered by Date
body:
## Summary
The /api/events endpoint returns expired recurring events that shouldn't appear in current date queries.

## Example
Querying for events on 2026-01-06 returns 'Tango Al Fresco' (a summer milonga) with startDate 2025-08-22.

## Location
Events.js lines 196-204

## Root Cause
Recurring events are returned without checking if their startDate/endDate range is relevant to the query date range. Events with isActive:true are returned regardless of season.

## Suggested Fix
Add date filtering logic to exclude recurring events whose date range doesn't overlap with the query range.

## Workaround
TangoVoice GPT will filter out events with startDate > 2 months in the past on the client side until this is fixed.

## Test Command
```bash
curl -s 'https://calendarbeaf-prod.azurewebsites.net/api/events?appId=1&start=2026-01-06&end=2026-01-06&categoryId=66c4d370a87a956db06c49e9&active=true'
```

-- Cronas
